text: Robert Farrington is an American personal finance expert and entrepreneur. == Background and Profession == Farrington was born in 1985 in San Diego, California. He pursued his Bachelor of Arts in Political Science from the University of California, San Diego and an MBA at the UC San Diego Rady School of Management. Farrington founded The College Investor, a personal finance website. It was founded in 2009 to help students understand personal finances. He is also the editor in chief of Cult of Money. Farrington also serves as an advisor to Chipper, a student loan repayment app. Heâ€™s also an advisor at FinTech and EdTech startups. Since 2014, he has been a senior contributor at Forbes covering the student loan crisis, FAFSA issues, and personal finance trends. He has also written for MSN, Washington Post, ABC News, NBC News and other financial publications. ==References== == External Links == * The College Investor * Forbes Contributor Page == References ==
title: Robert Farrington
